channel.title: GDACS RSS information
channel.description: Near real-time alerts about natural disaster with a potential humanitarian impact

item.title: Green flood alert in Nepal
item.description: On 01/07/2019, a flood started in Nepal, lasting until 01/08/2019 (last update). The flood caused 64 deaths and 3186 families displaced .
item.dc:subject: FL1

item.title: Green alert for tropical cyclone DANAS-19. Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.description: From 16/07/2019 to 17/07/2019, a Tropical Storm (maximum wind speed of 93 km/h) DANAS-19 was active in NWPacific. The cyclone affects these countries: Philippines, China, Japan, Korea, Republic of (vulnerability Medium). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.dc:subject: TC1

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.
gdacs:resource.gdacs:acknowledgements: Copyright European Union. Syndication allowed, provided the source is acknowledged.

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall (original)
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The original map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.

item.title: Green alert for tropical cyclone BARRY-19. Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.description: From 10/07/2019 to 14/07/2019, a Tropical Depression (maximum wind speed of 120 km/h) BARRY-19 was active in Atlantic. The cyclone affects these countries: United States (vulnerability Low). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.dc:subject: TC1
item.gdacs:severity: Tropical Depression (maximum wind speed of 56 km/h)
item.gdacs:population: Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.649 million

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.
gdacs:resource.gdacs:acknowledgements: Copyright European Union. Syndication allowed, provided the source is acknowledged.

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall (original)
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The original map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.

item.title: Green alert for tropical cyclone FOUR-E-19. Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.description: From 12/07/2019 to 14/07/2019, a Tropical Depression (maximum wind speed of 65 km/h) FOUR-E-19 was active in EastPacific. The cyclone affects these countries: [unknown] (vulnerability [unknown]). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.dc:subject: TC1
item.gdacs:severity: Tropical Depression (maximum wind speed of 46 km/h)

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.
gdacs:resource.gdacs:acknowledgements: Copyright European Union. Syndication allowed, provided the source is acknowledged.

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall (original)
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The original map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.
